newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-KILMARNOCK END 68-YEAR WAIT FOR CUP SUCCESS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-KILMARNOCK END 68-YEAR WAIT FOR CUP SUCCESS.

text.p: Kilmarnock won the Scottish Cup for the first time since 1929 with a 1-0 win over Falkirk in a tense final at Ibrox on Saturday.
A 21st minute close-range goal from Paul Wright, troubled by a gashed knee in the lead-up to the final, proved decisive although Falkirk looked to have equalised with five minutes left.
The ball was bundled into the Kilmarnock net by Neil Oliver but his celebrations were cut short by an offside flag which replays showed was justified.

Otherwise, the 112th Scottish Cup final was scarcely a classic but always held the attention of a crowd of just under 49,000. It was only the seventh Scottish final since 1957 not to feature either Rangers or Celtic.
